title: Ticket #6702: Allow NETWORK_HOSTNAME to be an alias hostname
description:
When NETWORK_HOSTNAME is set, we pass the value through getaddrinfo() to get a full canonical name. If the call fails, then get_local_hostname() is set to return the configured value and the value returned by get_local_fqdn() is uninitialized. If the call succeeds, then the values returned by get_local_hostname() and get_local_fqdn() are set based on the canonical name in the results.

This makes it impossible to use NETWORK_HOSTNAME to set a hostname that's a DNS CNAME (i.e. an alias hostname). The OSG wants to do precisely this to to ease relocation of glideinwms factory servers.

If NETWORK_HOSTNAME is set, then getaddrinfo() shouldn't be called at all. Instead, the short and full hostnames should be set based on the value of the parameter (using DEFAULT_DOMAIN_NAME if available and needed).
